revised_title: Experiments on the Combustion of Diamond and Other Carbonaceous Substances
tldr: Sir Humphry Davy conducts experiments on the combustion of diamonds and other carbonaceous substances, discovering that the gas produced in the process is chemically identical to that produced in the combustion of common charcoal. He also finds that diamonds do not produce any peculiar matter during combustion and that they lose their lustre rather than becoming black.
